instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1707: What is A1707? A1707 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Late 2016, Mid 2017 with EMC 3072, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00281, 820-00928..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS: What is PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS? PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS is 20v in from the USB-C charger on USB-C powered Macbook Pros..
definitions.SPI_MLBROM_CS_L: What is SPI_MLBROM_CS_L? SPI_MLBROM_CS_L is a signal that goes between the SPI ROM chip and another chip on machines with quad SPI, that can frequently corrode on 13‚Äù Macbook Air from 2015 because it is near the corner where liquid seeps in. This being corroded can stop PM_SLP_S4_L from being present. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Schematic and Boardview
threads.message:
Hi Guys,
I just got a mid-2017 15" Retina MacBook Pro in for repair. The logic board has some liquid damage. I'm not having any luck at all finding schematics and board view for this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A so I wanted to ask if anyone knows if this is available anywhere or if it's just not out in the wild yet. I know this forum isn't for sharing these documents and I'm not asking for someone to provide the documents, I just want to know if I should stop trying to find it if that makes sense.

Does anyone know if there are schematics for a different logic board that are similar enough to be useful?

Cheers,

Alex

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Schematic and Boardview
threads.message: I have not seen it. 00875 may be useful but the board view will of course be different. All circuit design is very similar between models but you have to figure out what is what.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Schematic and Boardview
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Schematic and Boardview
threads.message: Just in case anyone else reads this thread with the same original question that I had. The <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> schematic and board view are the closest things I could find that is similar enough to be useful for troubleshooting.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Schematic and Boardview
threads.message:
Hi

I have 1 macbook pro with 15-inch touchbar MB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Model: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1707</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> which has been damaged by a liquid.

Measuring the tensions I have
:
<SIGNAL>PP20V_USBC_XB_VBUS</SIGNAL> ----- F3001 = 20v

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  = 12,5v


<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_REG_R</SIGNAL>  = 3.4v

<SIGNAL>SPI_MLBROM_CS_L</SIGNAL> ---------- i only have this in SPI ROM  = 3.6v
